intro: Glochidion velutinum, commonly known as velvet glochidion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, simple leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically found in the axils of the leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky hillsides. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
